content.question:
<math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>DNA</mi></math> damage can lead to the release of the protein cytochrome c from mitochondria. Cytochrome c then activates the enzyme <math alttext="caspase 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>caspase-9</mtext></math>, resulting in the release of more cytochrome c, followed by apoptosis.
Which of the following best explains how the release of cytochrome c from mitochondria is regulated by feedback?

choices.label: It is positive feedback because the release of cytochrome c from mitochondria contributes to the production of more mitochondria.
It is negative feedback because the release of cytochrome c from mitochondria results in an increase in cell death.
It is positive feedback because the release of cytochrome c from mitochondria contributes to the release of more cytochrome.
It is negative feedback because the release of cytochrome c from mitochondria is caused by <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>DNA</mi></math> damage.

content.answer: It is positive feedback because the release of cytochrome c from mitochondria contributes to the release of more cytochrome.
